column1: NGR is the Ponders End Pumping Station, now the Navigation Inn. The 1950s record has the location as TQ360956, which does not look right, there is an Enfield Water Works 100 yards north of this 1950s location but this does not look right either. The 1910s record says gauge is about 250 yards West of the bank of King George V reservoir. the NGR used is 170 yards but a better fit than the other NGRs.
1920s record sheet is missing. The annual totals have been taken from the British Rainfall Reports.
1943 annual stated total does not match the sum of the monthly readings; modified to calculated values
